param.name: input_BAM
param.label: Select a BAM file
param.help: BAM format alignment file (Required to be sorted by start position)

param.name: input_FASTA
param.label: Select a FASTA file as reference

param.name: input_BAI
param.label: Select a .bai file as reference
param.help: The index file of the input BAM file (Required)

param.name: target_region
param.label: Target Region (optional)
param.help: Only call SNPs on given target region

param.name: sample_name
param.label: Sample name used in VCF file
param.help: If you select outputting genotypes in VCF format, sample name must be specified.

param.name: min_coverage
param.label: Minimal Coverage (optional)
param.help: Minimal Coverage required for high confidence SNP calls (Default is 8)

param.name: prior_prob_e
param.label: -e, prior probability (optional)
param.help: Prior(error|c) when variant coverage number is above 2 for 454 and Illumina data (Default is 0.1)

param.name: prior_prob_l
param.label: -l, prior probability (optional)
param.help: Prior(error|c) when variant coverage number is 1 or 2 for 454 data (Default is 0.9)

param.name: filter_m
param.label: -m, maximum percentage of substitution bases (optional)
param.help: maximum percentage of substitution bases allowed in the alignment (Default is 5.0)

param.name: filter_g
param.label: -g, maximum percentage of insertion and deletion bases (optional)
param.help: maximum percentage of insertion and deletion bases allowed in the alignment (Default is 5.0)

param.name: filter_f
param.label: -f, maximum number of alignments (optional)
param.help: maximum number of alignments allowed to be piled up on a site (Default is 1024)

param.name: filter_p
param.label: -p, insertion size for pair-end re-sequencing data (optional)
param.help: insertion size for pair-end re-sequencing data (Default is 0)

tool.help:
Atlas-SNP2_ is designed to evaluate and distinguish true SNPs from sequencing and mapping errors in whole-exome capture sequencing (WECS) data.
.. _Atlas-SNP2: http://www.hgsc.bcm.tmc.edu/cascade-tech-software_atlas2_snp_indel_calling_pipeline-ti.hgsc
**Usage:**
ruby Atlas-SNP2.rb Atlas-SNP2.rb -i [in.sorted.bam] -r [reference.fa] -o [output file] [choosing platform] [Setting up VCF output] [choosing platform] [Setting up VCF output]
**Arguments:**
Atlas-SNP2 is coded in Ruby and basic usage can be viewed by running the program without any arguments.
-i FILE BAM format alignment file (Required to be sorted by start position)
-r FILE FASTA format reference sequence file (Required)
-o STR name of output result file (Required)
-t STR Only call SNPs on given target region (Optional, please refer "samtools view" for the target region format)
Platform:
-s Illumina
-x 454 Titanium
Setting up VCF output:
-v Output genotypes in VCF format
-n Sample name used in VCF file (Required when choosing VCF output)
-c Posterior probability cutoff (Default is 0.95)
-y Minimal Coverage required for high confidence SNP calls (Default is 8)
Setting up prior probability:
-e FLT Prior(error|c) when variant coverage number is above 2 for 454 and Illumina data (Default is 0.1)
-l FLT Prior(error|c) when variant coverage number is 1 or 2 for 454 data (Default is 0.9)
Setting up filters:
-m FLT maximum percentage of substitution bases allowed in the alignment (Default is 5.0)
-g FLT maximum percentage of insertion and deletion bases allowed in the alignment (Default is 5.0)
-f INT maximum number of alignments allowed to be piled up on a site (Default is 1024)
-p INT insertion size for pair-end re-sequencing data (Default is 0)
